sen.j: 井田 武雄（いだ たけお、嘉永4年（1851年）11月 - 昭和8年（1933年））は、日本の医師、実業家。
sen.e: Takeo IDA (November, 1851 - 1933) was a Japanese doctor and businessman.
Takeo IDA (November, 1851 - 1933) was a Japanese doctor and businessman.
Takeo IDA (November, 1851 - 1933) was a Japanese doctor and businessman.

sen.j: 号は陸舟。
sen.e: His pen name was Rikushu.
His pen name was Rikushu.
His pen name was Rikushu.

sen.j: 鳥取県西伯郡中浜村（現在の境港市）出身。
sen.e: He was born in Nakahama Village, Saihaku District (current Sakaiminato City), Tottori Prefecture.
He was from Nakahama Village, Saihaku County (current Sakaiminato City), Tottori Prefecture.
He was from Nakahama Village, Saihaku County (current Sakaiminato City), Tottori Prefecture.

sen.j: 井田義枝の次男として生まれる。
sen.e: He was born as the second son of Yoshie IDA.
sen.cmt: 「井田義枝」の読みが不明です。
sen.e: He was born as the second son of Yoshie IDA.
He was born as the second son of Yoshie IDA.

sen.j: 慶応元年（1865年）長崎に出て長崎養生所(現・長崎大学医学部)に学び、蘭方医学を修めた
sen.e: In 1865, he moved to Nagasaki and studied at Nagasaki Yojosho (current Nagasaki University, School of Medicine) and graduated with a degree in Ranpo medicine (Western medicine by means of the Dutch language).
In 1865, he moved to Nagasaki and studied Ranpo-igaku (Western medicine by means of the Dutch language) at Nagasaki Yojosho (current Nagasaki University, School of Medicine).
In 1865, he moved to Nagasaki and studied Ranpo-igaku (Western medicine by means of the Dutch language) at Nagasaki Yojosho (current Nagasaki University, School of Medicine).

sen.j: 明治7年（1874年）長崎養生所を出た。
sen.e: He left Nagasaki Yojosho in 1874.
He left Nagasaki Yojosho in 1874.
He left Nagasaki Yojosho in 1874.

sen.j: 明治10年（1877年）の西南戦争に警視庁医員として従軍し功をたてる。
sen.e: He distinguished himself as medical staff of Keishi-cho (Tokyo Metropolitan Police Department) in the Seinan War in 1877.
In the Seinan War of 1877, he went to the front as medical staff of Metropolitan Police Department and produced some achievement.
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミスがあります。
sen.e: In the Seinan War of 1877, he went to the front as medical staff of Metropolitan Police Department and produced some achievement.

sen.j: 明治11年（1878年）海軍軍医に転じ、軍艦「鳳翔 (砲艦)」軍医として韓国に派遣され、韓国人の診療に活躍した。
sen.e: He became a navy doctor in 1878 and was sent to Korea on the military ship 'Hosho (Gunboat)'; he did an excellent job in treating the Koreans.
In 1878 he became medical officer of the navy and was sent to Korea on the warship (gunboat) 'Hosho'; he did an excellent job in treating Koreans.
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミスがあります。
sen.e: In 1878 he became medical officer of the navy and was sent to Korea on the warship (gunboat) 'Hosho'; he did an excellent job in treating Koreans.

sen.j: 帰国後海軍を辞し、養神病院長となり、明教生命保険の設立計画をした。
sen.e: After returning to Japan, he resigned from the navy and became the director of Yoshin Hospital; he was planning to establish the Meikyo Life Insurance Company.
sen.cmt: 「明教生命保険」は下の人名辞典の抜粋を見ると会社のようですので"company"としました。
sen.e: After returning to Japan, he resigned from the navy and became the director of Yoshin Hospital; and he planned to establish the Meikyo Life Insurance Company.
sen.cmt: 文法のミスがあります。
sen.e: After returning to Japan, he resigned from the navy and became the director of Yoshin Hospital; and he planned to establish the Meikyo Life Insurance Company.

sen.j: また、政府高官であった大隈重信、板垣退助らの後援を得て、佐々友房、柴四朗、荒尾精らと謀り、東方通商協会を設立して、本部を上海市に置き、東亜問題に画策した。
sen.e: With the support from the high government officials Shigenobu OKUMA and Taisuke ITAGAKI, he worked together with Tomofusa SASSA, Shiro SHIBA and Sei ARAO to establish Toho-tsusho Kyokai (Eastern Commerce Association) with the main office in Shanghai; and heavily involved with the East Asian issues.
sen.cmt: 「養神病院」の読みはこれでいいでしょうか。「東亜問題」の定訳不明。
sen.e: With the support from high government officials including Shigenobu OKUMA and Taisuke ITAGAKI, he worked together with Tomofusa SASSA, Shiro SHIBA and Sei ARAO to establish Toho-tsusho Kyokai (Eastern Commerce Association); he located the main office in Shanghai and was deeply involved in operations for settling the issues in East Asia.

With the support from high government officials including Shigenobu OKUMA and Taisuke ITAGAKI, he worked together with Tomofusa SASSA, Shiro SHIBA and Sei ARAO to establish Toho-tsusho Kyokai (Eastern Commerce Association); he located the main office in Shanghai and was deeply involved in operations for settling the issues in East Asia.

sen.j: 明治28年（1895年）日清戦争後の台湾の帰属問題から、台湾島民の反乱となり、日本軍の出兵、台湾占領に至る。
sen.e: Due to the ownership issue in Taiwan after the Sino-Japanese War in 1895, Taiwan islanders started a rebellion and Japan occupied Taiwan after they dispatched their troops.
In 1895 after the Sino-Japanese War, the arguments on the ownership of Taiwan caused the rebellion of the residents of Taiwan Island, and Japan dispatched the troops and ended up occupying Taiwan.
In 1895 after the Sino-Japanese War, the arguments on the ownership of Taiwan caused the rebellion of the residents of Taiwan Island, and Japan dispatched the troops and ended up occupying Taiwan.

sen.j: この折に武雄は台湾一等公医となり、台湾ペスト病院長として赴任した。
sen.e: Takeo became a Taiwan's First-class Official Doctor and took his post as the director of the Taiwan Hospital for the Black Plague Patients.
sen.cmt: 「台湾一等公医」、「台湾ペスト病院」の定訳不明。
sen.e: At that time Takeo became the first-grade official doctor of Taiwan and took his post as director of Taiwan Plague Hospital.
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミスがあります。
sen.e: At that time Takeo became the first-grade official doctor of Taiwan and took his post as director of Taiwan Plague Hospital.

sen.j: 台北にあって荒尾などと調停の努力をしたが 同志荒尾の死去にあう。
sen.e: In Taipei, he made an effort for peacekeeping with Arao and others but his comrade Arao died.
In Taipei, he worked hard as mediation together with his fellows including Arao, however his fellow Arao died.
In Taipei, he worked hard as mediation together with his fellows including Arao, however his fellow Arao died.

sen.j: また武雄自身も、日本官憲の台湾島民に対する暴挙に抗議し、却って土匪教唆として投獄されたりして、その志は断たれた。
sen.e: Because Takeo was opposed to acts of violence of the Japanese officials toward Taiwan islanders, he was jailed for a charge of abetting act of anti-government; his hopes were dashed.
Besides Takeo himself was jailed for a charge of abetting the residents since he had objected to Japanese officials' outrages upon residents of Taiwan, so his hope was dashed.
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミスがあります。
sen.e: Besides Takeo himself was jailed for a charge of abetting the residents since he had objected to Japanese officials' outrages upon residents of Taiwan, so his hope was dashed.

sen.j: 東京に帰った武雄は明治30年（1897年）四谷病院長となった。
sen.e: He went back to Japan and became the director of Yotsuya Hospital in 1897.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He went back to Japan and became the director of Yotsuya Hospital in 1897.
He went back to Japan and became the director of Yotsuya Hospital in 1897.

sen.j: その経営にあたり、大正3年（1914年）幸楽病院長として診療に従事した。
sen.e: He was managing the hospital, then engaged himself in medical practice after becoming the director of Koraku Hospital in 1914.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He managed the hospital, and in 1914 became the director of Koraku Hospital and engaged himself in medical practice.
He managed the hospital, and in 1914 became the director of Koraku Hospital and engaged himself in medical practice.

sen.j: 昭和に入って同病院の顧問として働きながらも、東亜問題については有志と通じていたという。
sen.e: After the Showa period started, he still kept contacting with fellows on East Asian issues while working as a consultant at the hospital.
After the Showa period started, he still kept contacting with fellows on East Asian issues while working as a consultant at the hospital.
After the Showa period started, he still kept contacting with fellows on East Asian issues while working as a consultant at the hospital.

sen.j: 住所は東京市四谷区永住町（現･新宿区四谷）となっているが、遺族の消息は不明である。
sen.e: According to a record, his address was Nagasumi-cho, Yotsuya Ward, Tokyo (current Yotsuya, Shinjyuku Ward), however the whereabouts of the surviving members of his family are unknown.
According to a record, his address was Nagasumi-cho, Yotsuya Ward, Tokyo (current Yotsuya, Shinjyuku Ward), however the whereabouts of the surviving members of his family are unknown.
According to a record, his address was Nagasumi-cho, Yotsuya Ward, Tokyo (current Yotsuya, Shinjyuku Ward), however the whereabouts of the surviving members of his family are unknown.

sen.j: 井田家は上総国武射郡坂田城主井田胤徳の末裔とつたえられ､武雄は刑部大輔より25世の子孫であると称している。『実業家人名事典』より。
sen.e: The Ida family were descendants from Tanenori IDA who was the lord of Sakata Castle in Musha District of Kazusa Province and Takeo was thought to be the 25th descendant of the Gyobu no taifu (Senior Assistant Minister of Justice) (from "Biographical Dictionary of Businessmen").
sen.cmt: 『実業家人名事典』は定訳不明です。
sen.e: It has been said that the Ida family was descendants of Tanenori IDA who had been the lord of Sakata Castle of Musha County of Kazusa Province, and Takeo said that he was the 25th descendant of the Gyobu no taifu (Senior Assistant Minister of Justice) (from "Biographical Dictionary of Businessmen").

It has been said that the Ida family was descendants of Tanenori IDA who had been the lord of Sakata Castle of Musha County of Kazusa Province, and Takeo said that he was the 25th descendant of the Gyobu no taifu (Senior Assistant Minister of Justice) (from "Biographical Dictionary of Businessmen").

sen.j: 上杉謙信、武田勝頼、徳川秀忠等が井田家の祖先に送った書簡(手紙)を家宝として所蔵する。
sen.e: They possessed letters from Kenshin UESUGI, Katsuyori TAKEDA and Hidetada TOKUGAWA to the ancestors of Ida family as family treasures.
They possessed letters from Kenshin UESUGI, Katsuyori TAKEDA and Hidetada TOKUGAWA to the ancestors of Ida family as family treasures.
They possessed letters from Kenshin UESUGI, Katsuyori TAKEDA and Hidetada TOKUGAWA to the ancestors of Ida family as family treasures.

sen.j: 大正人名辞典・井田武雄 抜粋
sen.e: Below is the abstract from the section of Takeo IDA in the Taisho Biographical Dictionary
Below is the abstract from the section of Takeo IDA in the Taisho Biographical Dictionary
Below is the abstract from the section of Takeo IDA in the Taisho Biographical Dictionary

sen.j: 君は嘉永四年十一月を以て鳥取縣西伯郡中浜村に生る。
sen.e: Takeo was born on November 1851 in Nakahama Village, Saihaku County, Tottori Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Takeo was born on November 1851 in Nakahama Village, Saihaku County, Tottori Prefecture.
Takeo was born on November 1851 in Nakahama Village, Saihaku County, Tottori Prefecture.

sen.j: 嚴父義枝氏亦憂國の志士なり。
sen.e: His father Yoshie was also a samurai of the area.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: His father Yoshie was also a person worrying about the nation's future and devoting himself to the nation.
His father Yoshie was also a person worrying about the nation's future and devoting himself to the nation.

sen.j: 蓋君の家系を聞くに遠く葛原親王に出て､而して乃祖井田刑部大輔は實に上總國武射郡坂田の城主なりき。
sen.e: His family line goes back to Imperial Prince Kazuwara, and the Gyobu no taifu (Senior Assistant Minister of Justice) was the lord of Sakata Castle in Musha District of Kazusa Province.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: His family line goes back to Imperial Prince Katsurabara, and his ancestor Gyobu no taifu IDA was, in fact, the lord of Sakata Castle in Musha County of Kazusa Province.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れを補います。『大辞泉』他国語辞書によると「葛原親王」は「かつらばらしんのう」または「かずらはらしんのう」です。
sen.e: His family line goes back to Imperial Prince Katsurabara, and his ancestor Gyobu no taifu IDA was, in fact, the lord of Sakata Castle in Musha County of Kazusa Province.

sen.j: 是を以て元亀天正年間には､刑部の子孫は兵馬倥傯の間に奔走した。
sen.e: During the Genki and Tesei eras (between 1500 and 1593) his descendants fought among the soldiers with their horses.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: During the Genki era and the Tensho era (between 1570 and 1592) Keibu's descendants fought in the fierce battles.
sen.cmt: 固有名詞、数字の間違いがあります。「兵馬倥傯」は武器と馬が激しく交錯する様、すなわち激しい戦闘を意味します。
sen.e: During the Genki era and the Tensho era (between 1570 and 1592) Keibu's descendants fought in the fierce battles.

sen.j: 百戰千鬪の功を樹て､武名を関東に揚げたる名門の裔なるを以て､君及嚴父の國事を憂ふるもの､蓋偶然に非ざるを知るべし､君は慶應元年､崎陽に遊學して醫術を長崎醫学校の前身たる『養生所』に研究する。
sen.e: With their 100-year of great service and being a descendant of this family, although he was worried about national affairs, he went to Kiyo and studied medicine at the "Yojosho", later Nagasaki Medical School in 1865.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Since being from such noble family which ancestor had established great achievement in many battles and their names as samurai had spread among Kanto region, it is not surprising that his father was worried about national affairs; in 1865 he went to Kiyo (Nagasaki)and studied medicine at the 'Yojosho' which later became Nagasaki Medical School.

Since being from such noble family which ancestor had established great achievement in many battles and their names as samurai had spread among Kanto region, it is not surprising that his father was worried about national affairs; in 1865 he went to Kiyo (Nagasaki)and studied medicine at the 'Yojosho' which later became Nagasaki Medical School.

sen.j: 明治初年其業を卒るや､遠く加奈太政廳聘に應じ留まること三星霜にして其業更に進み､而して任滿ち歸朝する。
sen.e: After graduating there in 1868, he was invited to Canada, stayed there for 3 years and returned to Japan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After graduating from the school in 1868, he accepted the invitation from the government of Canada and went to Canada; during his stay for three years, he furthered his learning, and after the end of the term, he returned to Japan.

After graduating from the school in 1868, he accepted the invitation from the government of Canada and went to Canada; during his stay for three years, he furthered his learning, and after the end of the term, he returned to Japan.

sen.j: 警視廳に醫員を拜命す､幾もなくして西南戰役に會する。
sen.e: He became medical staff of the Keishi-cho (Tokyo Metropolitan Police Department), then soon he saw that the Seinan War had started.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He was appointed medical staff of Metropolitan Police Department, and soon he happened to be involved in the Seinan War.
He was appointed medical staff of Metropolitan Police Department, and soon he happened to be involved in the Seinan War.

sen.j: 君亦醫を以て從軍し功を樹つること尠なからず､後海軍醫に轉じ軍艦鳳翔號の軍醫長として韓国に赴く。
sen.e: He served well with his medical skills and later he turned into a military doctor; and as the head doctor, he went to Korea on the military ship, Hosho.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He worked in the war with his medical skills and produced a lot of achievements, and later he became medical officer of the navy and went to Korea as chief of medical officers of the warship Hosho-go.

He worked in the war with his medical skills and produced a lot of achievements, and later he became medical officer of the navy and went to Korea as chief of medical officers of the warship Hosho-go.

sen.j: 韓人を診脈して嘖々の譽を博す。
sen.e: He treated Koreans and they greatly honored him for his service.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He treated Koreans and they greatly honored him for his service.
He treated Koreans and they greatly honored him for his service.

sen.j: 斯くして或いは東京養神病院を起し､或いは明教生命保險會社を創立する等､醫術以外事業を創刱することその幾許なるを知らず
sen.e: He started the Tokyo Yoshin Hospital and the Meikyo Life Insurance Company; he established businesses other than in medicine.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After that he established Tokyo Yoshin Hospital and Meikyo Life Insurance Company and so on; he not only developed medicine, but also built so many businesses that we cannot enumerate all of them.
After that he established Tokyo Yoshin Hospital and Meikyo Life Insurance Company and so on; he not only developed medicine, but also built so many businesses that we cannot enumerate all of them.
